ai.summary: London LOOP (Section 21) is a 19.5 km section of the London LOOP long-distance path in the United Kingdom. This hard-rated route traverses mixed terrain including urban segments, woodland trails, and rural footpaths, with elevation gain and several road crossings. Suitable for experienced walkers with good navigation and stamina.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines woodland tracks, grassy paths, and occasional surfaced lanes. Expect uneven footing in forest sections, occasional mud after rain, short steep ascents/descents, and some exposed sections. Potential for busy road crossings where the path leaves and re-enters urban areas.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather, daylight hours, and possible crowds in urban stretches. Stay on official path, watch for traffic at road crossings, and bookmark easy bailout points. Bring a map or GPS, know the route, and inform someone of your plans. In remote sections, mobile coverage may be patchy; carry a fully charged phone and a basic first aid kit.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device with offline access
Weather-appropriate layers and waterproof outer shell
Hat and sunglasses for sun protection
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
Light rain cover or packable waterproofs
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) for better daylight and moderate weather; be prepared for cold or wet conditions in shoulder seasons.

seo.title: London LOOP Section 21 Hiking Guide - 19.5 km Hard Walk in UK
seo.meta_description: Discover London LOOP Section 21: a 19.5 km hard hike through mixed terrain in the UK. Explore terrain, safety tips, gear and best seasons for this challenging segment.
